title: Disappearing Prisoners

> ##cyan|**Z3r0-V1rus**## 15/11/2022 (Tue) 14:20:28 #12865494 
> ------
> [[size 120%]] My brother works in a state penitentiary and strange things have been happening to some prisoners.[[/size]]
> ------
> That's pretty much the gist of the story.
> My brother works in a state penitentiary as a guard, they got some of the nastiest people they could possibly house in the prison system.
> This includes death row as well.
> 
> I went to see him yesterday and after we talked for a moment he mentioned something strange happening.
> He said that sometimes they get in orders for prisoners (both death row and lifetime) to be moved by some outside company or some obscure government branch.
> 
> It happened again not too long ago and he decided to look into it after some of the transports should have arrived. He contacted whatever prison the inmates supposedly went to, but they said the prisoner never arrived.
> When he checked the prison registry the prisoners were still logged as in the prison, (not as escaped or transported), but supposedly actually in their own cell as well.
> 
> I get these are prisoners and that death row inmates have this subhuman status, but doesn't it look like the government is disappearing people? That also means they're not getting an actual trial or anything.
> 
> Anyone else seen this happen or hell, heard of this happening? Can't be good if the government is disappearing people even if they're in prison.
> ------
> @@                               @@##red|[THREAD LOCKED]##

> My brother lost his job. I have personally asked the mods to lock the thread.
> 
> He lied about what he had found apparently. He was on drugs and was going to try and get money out of me afterward for more information because he knows I use this forum. 
> 
> I found out because a couple of days ago, I suddenly had police at my door. Some fancy suited Vice detective and some normal cops came to tell me because I am one of his main contacts. I hate cops at my door as much as the next person, but they checked out. I had them show me their IDs which for once they willingly did and I didn't see anything wrong with them or the IDs.
> 
> Sorry to accidentally mislead you all, I truly didn't know this wasn't real either. I have asked staff to lock this thread when I post it because this is only meant to be an update.
>
